title: How are the free apps in Google Play store generating revenue? - Quora

response.answer_text: According to a research, 90% of consumers spent their maximum time on mobile apps. So the challenging part for your business is to choose the perfect app that will ultimately attract user’s interest towards the app. If you have above 100k app downlaods, you can easily earn around 100 USD to 700 USD only through advertisements. The amount varies as per the location, Active installs, active users etc. So before you put all your money in developing an app, here’s to recognize how it can generate money for your business: Free of charge apps or paid apps- Being a business owner, you have the option whether you want to offer free apps or you can charge per app download. With the business point of view, you would obviously prefer to generate higher returns through charging on per download. 1) In-App Purchases : This is the most popular way of earning. In this method, user will downlaod the app for free and it allows the userr to make the purchases right inside the mobiel app. Example of In-App purchases : a) Subscription : You may have noticed in some applications, that to unlock premium features pay xyz amount etc. This comes under subscription, it can be for short duration of time ot on a permanent base.- Live example you can check with Shaddi.com, they offer in xyz amount for 6 months you will that abc features. b) Consumable : Typically this is used in mobile games. It encourage for repeat purchases such as buying extra lives in Candy Crush, extra gems, extra points inside a game. c) Non-consumable : You might have come across the mobile apps that offer a paid version (withou ads or ad free). Non-consumable products are permanent in most cases. 2) Take the help of Ads :This the easiest to implement (3rd party ad network) and most common too. Types of Ads: a) Interstitial Ads:these type of ads are typically displayed at natural transition points in the flow of the app. Closely related to pop-ups they generally cover up the entire space of the app screenThe uninterested users can click the cross button to stop seeing this kind of ad. b) Banner Ads:These image-based ads (samll strips) appear on the top or bottom of the app screen. These kind of ads are mostly used ads, since they don't hinder the user experience. c) In-app Video Ads:Video advertising is already booming. In-app video ads are automatically placed in the app and are used as an exchange for some in-app reward. For an instance, it can be video that user has to see when he/she completes a level in any game to unlock the next level. d) Native ads:Native Ads are different from other advertisements as they seem like a natural app element.User are not annoyed by these kind of ads which is why these are the most preferred ads. 3) Physical Purchase :You may have noticed many ecommerce businesses publish app for free to sell physical goods. 4) Referral Marketing :This is one of the primary app marketing method, in whcih app publisher promote other third party products/services, This trick can actually work wonders for your app if done right. It helps you attract customers that are loyal and profitable. Different type of Referral Marketing : a) Cost Per Click (CPC ):This type of model is based on a number of clicks on the ad displayed. It includes both text and display advertisements. b) Cost Per View (CPV):This model involves monetization based on the number of ad interactions or video views. c) Cost Per Install (CPI):You get paid for each advertised app install within your free app. There are a number of mobile advertising platforms that aims to drive more users, generate more money and offer a rich personalized experience on your platform.

There are lots of ways to generate money from your application. There are definitely some peculiar features in monetization of certain app categories. The main monetization models are the following: Advertising. You choose the ad formats that you’d like to implement, choose an SDK (monetization solution) that you’d like to use and start running ads and earning money. I recommend you to use ad mediation platform because you will be connected to multiple ad networks at once and thus, they will compete for your traffic and you will sell it at a higher price. We’ve gathered the most popular and effective ad formats here - Epom Apps | Ad FormatsFreemium. The app is offered for free, but certain features are unavailable and user has to pay to unlock them. In other words, people have access to an app's basic functionality, but there is a charge for premium or proprietary features.In–App Purchases. This app monetization strategy involves selling physical or virtual goods within your app, and then retaining the profits.Subscriptions. This monetization model is similar to the freemium model except that it focuses on granting content, not features. User can view a certain amount of content for free and then it has to sign up for a paid subscription to get more. This model is best suited for service focused apps.Sponsorship. It requires partnership with advertisers, who provide app users with rewards for completing certain in-app actions. In this model, brands and agencies pay to be part of the motivational system. Your app earns money by taking a share of the revenue from redeemed rewards.To my mind, in-app advertising is the easiest and the quickest to implement monetization model. Due to our experience, it may take like an hour in order to integrate SDK and start earning.If you’d like to start with this model, our team we’ll be glad to help you with that. You may find more information on our website - Epom Apps | Powerful and simple mobile monetization platform for iOS and Android apps Hope this information helps.

By the following ways Android apps make money. 1. The Freemium Upsell This requires having a second version of your app that’s paid. Typically you’ll see this as the “Lite” and “Regular” or “HD” versions of an app, paired together. The free app will have a link that a user can click that drives them to the iTunes store on their phone. It’s kind of a feeder system – users can download your free app and get a sense of what you have to offer, then they can easily purchase the full version (which will have lots more functionality and game play.) 2. In-App Purchases In-app purchases can also be subscriptions if you were in the market of news feeds. The Newsstand functionality within the Apple framework allows you to set up an in-app purchase that will automatically charge every month. 3. Ads 4.Sponsorship 5. CPI Networks (Cost Per Install) Cost per install is a relatively new marketing mechanism and is the mobile equivalent to CPA (cost per acquisition) in the web marketing world. CPI is exactly what it sounds like – you pay per install that you get.

A research by Distimo revealed that in-app purchases through free apps account for more than 98% of revenue generated by the Google Play store in 2013. This indicates that even if the apps run for free, they tend to earn much more money than paid apps , Which explains the phenomenal success of the Freemium model. Many apps and games have the ability to catch your attention with the promise for free, but after your credit card information has been attached, you will not mind spending a few dollars on the game just for the sake of continuity. The remaining 2% of revenue generated by the Android App Center came from paid apps and paid apps with in-app purchases (mostly games). This could be a nice lesson for many Android developers looking to make the most of the freemium model and entice fans to make money for their apps through in-app purchases. This is a trend that iOS AppStore also follows, so don't be surprised when the Google Play Store gets the same result, especially considering the sheer amount of free apps available I advise you to start from here, it will be a great success for you

Free App Can Be Your Money Making Machine Do you have a product concept that you want people to engage in? Are you looking to launch an application that will interact best with target audience? Well, you are not the only one.     It is not an easy job to attract people and allow them to use your app for free, all the while expecting your business to go up. You might be having cold feet about your start-up plan. Will you do great? Will people buy it? Is your app able enough to generate estimated revenue? Will your efforts see desired result? No matter if you are an established player or a start-up owner, it is usual to feel nervous at the start of any project.  Free App Can Be Your Money Making Machine

The free apps in google play store earn money from mainly two methods. 1: ads 2: in-app purchase Lets talks briefly about both the thing so that you get to know about earning methods of the free app in play store 1: Ads Many of the developers use AdMob to monetize their app. Google AdMob is an amazing platform to monetize your application. They have very high revenue rates and you can earn more money from Google AdMob. 2: in-app purchase In-app purchase is another good strategy by a developer to earn more money. In the app, purchase simply works like that if you make any purchase in that app such as buying gems, gold, life, etc are come in-app purchase. These are the two methods by which free app earn money. The main monetization methods include: Paid download – according to Statista, less than 6% of apps are paid downloadAd revenue – according to Android Authority, 49% of Android apps contain ads; however, the percentage of revenue generated from ads is much lower than that from in-app purchases, according to a collection of statistics collated by app engagement vendor, AppBoy.In-app purchases – Most apps these days opt for a freemium or in-app purchase model, whereby users can download the app for free, but then must pay to unlock features or in-app content. The same AppBoy study per ad revenue above also cites Appsflyer research that 5.2% of users make an in-app purchase, yet Statista forecasts in 2017 that in-app purchases will overtake paid downloads as the number one revenue-generating method for apps.E-commerce – Localytics put together a study on e-commerce performance benchmarks, counting 37,000 apps which monetized with this method.Affiliate partnership – Typically, apps which have a lot of content monetize through advertising or become affiliates.Learn more: Mobile App Monetization: Show me the Money

3 ways  I know for free Android apps to make money on Google Play Store: 1. In-app purchase : (most common) After installing the app or game, users might want to buy some tools to get a next level or some kind of advanced features. Those will require purchase and the users need to pay. 2. In-app advertisement : (most common) The app will display Banner/Video/Interstitial Ads, etc inside. When users are playing app/game, the Ads suddenly pops up and the users might click the Ads and/or install the Ads app. So the developers can get revenue through Ads based on CPCs (the amount of users' clicks), CPIs (the amount of Ads app installs), CPAs (the amount of Ads app installs&registration), etc. 3. Subscription: (Some) Some app companies, Evernote for example, show the app as free. While after install, it might require you to purchase its services.

You can go for any of the two most prevalent models of monetising apps You can go for either ad revenue. Google, Facebook all provide banner ad options for your app. Their integration is simple and fairly easy to use. The company gets the clients and pay you a commission based on the number of times that ad was displayed on your app.You can go for the more complex more that is actually favoured by customers. Its the freemium model, which is basically offering the app for free and then charging the customer for additional features once they are hooked on the app. You can charge for additional features, bonuses, add-ons, and to unlock some blocked faturesThe last way is to create a pro version of the app. I won't recommend this as conversation rates in this case is usually low but you can create a pro version which people may buy after having used and experienced the free version.

1. In-app advertisement : Ads (interstitial/banner) displayed in an application generate a lot of money for a developer if the application has a lot of active users. 2. In-app purchase : The app will be available to all for free but most of its useful and attractive features will be locked ( like extra filter in Photo editing apps e.g. Retrica , extra moves in a game e.g. Candy crush saga ) then the user needs to pay for it. 3. Subscription - Few companies will provide the app for free and then ask you to pay for some more advanced and useful features e.g. extra cloud storage in Evernote. Well there are two ways to monetize a free app: in app purchases or advertisements. In app purchases Here the app offers products you can buy in order to boost your experience in the app or gain features out of the app. Apps like Pokémon Go, Modern Combat, Candycrush, photo editing application may charge you for new filters or buying poke balls or customizing your weapons in modern combat, often application with in app purchases end up making more money than paid ones. Advertisement You can place adds In your app using Google Adword or other services. Which will pay you for the amount of clicks made in adds, or amount of videos watched, the greater the amount of clicks the more money you earn. However placing ads in you app may create a bad experience for the user since most ads will use a considerable real estate in their app screen or may pop up every time and annoy the user. I hope it helped.

There are various ways. The primary source is google itself. When the number of downloads reaches a specific limit(I don't know the exact number), google pays you an amount.Secondary ways include advertisement banners in your app. When people click those ad links, you earn money. The more the clicks, the more you earn. For example, if the ad service provider is google, then you are paid when the earned money reaches $100.One more way of earning with apps is subscription fee. You might have noticed that some apps are free only for a small time (called trial period). After that, you are asked to pay a fee to purchase the app.

As we all know, not all apps are paid, some are free to download. But the question is how google makes money from free apps on google play. well, I have your answer. Two sources as of my knowledge, Google charges a developer account fee, which is paid once a year, and each app on play store is published by a developer who has this membership.Most of the free apps include adds. Those adds are posted by google ads, for every ad we watch both google and developer will be granted money, obviously bigger cut is of developer, that is how developers as well as google get paid for free apps. [BONUS] Google is also paid by the advertisers.

Yes. You can make money by publishing an ads integrated free app in Google play.  You can create an app and integrate banner ads, Interstitial ads or other type of ads from Admob, AirPush, StartApp or any other ad network. Once you published the app, you will get money for user clicks and 1000 ad impressions. To make good money out of apps, you should have good number of daily users for your app.

It depends upon your objective of making the app. Whether you want to grow your user base and sell the app at a later time or whether you want to have a steady income from the start. My opinion is quite different from the other writers. If you display an ad from the beginning in your app then people won’t mind it. Although the no of downloads would be low your active number of users will be actually high than if you introduce an ad after 10,000 downloads. Because people will then start uninstalling your app because they won’t be comfortable with your app anymore. My app has just crossed 1000 download and i have introduced a banner ad and i am earning around 0.05$ daily. It’s quite an insignificant amount but as the downloads increases the revenue also increases. Hope it helps.
